wikipedia_page.main: Percy Knott (1899 – unknown) was an English footballer who played in the Football League for Stoke.

response: Steventon was born in Nantwich and played for Walsall, Wednesbury Old Athletic, Southampton, Aston Villa and Nantwich Victoria before joining Stoke in 1920. He played three matches for Stoke at the end of the 1920–21 season in place of Percy Knott. At the end of the season he re-joined Nantwich Victoria and served as back up 'keeper at Wolverhampton Wanderers in 1922.

Lee was born in Brierley Hill and played for Cradley Heath and Wulfrunians before joining Aston Villa in 1919. He played 18 times for Villa in two seasons and left for Stoke in 1921. At Stoke he shared goalkeeping duties with Tom Kay and Percy Knott in 1921–22 with Lee playing in 24 matches but he deemed surplus to requirements at the end of the season and was allowed to join Macclesfield.
* Percy Knott, English footballer in the 1920s
